A classification method determines how d: A classification method determines how data values are grouped into ranges or categories to color regions on a choropleth map. The recommended method is based on the selected metric. For more information for each method, see the help icon next to each method.
Region tracking is a new feature, so thi: Region tracking is a new feature, so this data is only available for visits recorded after it was enabled.

Divides data into equal-sized groups, en: Splits data into groups of equal size, making sure each category contains the same number of regions. Ideal for metrics that are evenly spread out, such as Pageviews or Visitors.
Groups data based on how far values devi: Organizes data by the extent to which values differ from the average. Emphasizes outliers in metrics such as Bounce Rate or Avg. Session Duration.
Splits the data range into equal-sized i: Splits the data range into equal-sized intervals. Ideal for percentage-based metrics like Bounce Rate or Conversion Rate.
Finds patterns in the data to create cat: Identifies patterns in the data to form categories with minimal variation within groups. This approach is effective for all metrics, particularly Pageviews and Conversion Rate.
